intro: Hippocratea crenata, commonly known as the crested hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that are clustered in racemes, often with a pleasant fragrance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
